item.title: Co-Op Horror 'Reanimal' Launches February 2026, Demo Coming Soon
item.content:encoded:
Set your calendar

THQ Nordic and Tarsier Studios have announced that Reanimal will launch on the Switch 2 on 13th February 2026.

The highly-anticipated spiritual successor to Little Nightmares (which was also handled by Tarsier Studios before handing the reins over to Supermassive Games for the third entry) will also gain a free demo in the coming weeks, just in case you want to try it out yourself before opting for the full game.

A $59.99 Digital Deluxe Edition will be available on launch, and this will include the base game, Season Pass, and the exclusive Foxhead and Muttonhead masks. Tarsier has also stressed that while this is primarily a co-op experience, solo players can also experience the game, with an AI taking on the role of your companion.

It looks awesome, and we genuinely can't wait to dive in. For now, let's check out the key features:

- Horror With Hope ‚Äì In this unsettling tale, the emphasis is on tension and thick atmosphere, as you join the two orphans on a desperate search for hope and redemption in the direst of circumstances.

- Across a Dark and Twisted World ‚Äì Traverse an intriguing but terrifying world, where the main path is only one part of the fragmented story. Discover all sorts of mysterious locations on your perilous journey, each with its own story to tell.

- A Dread-Filled Adventure ‚Äì Tarsier Studios is bringing their unique visual style to bear on a whole host of new twisted monsters and broken, yet resilient, child characters. Fragments of the children‚Äôs troubled past have been used as inspiration for their character design, and for the monsters that now torment them.

- Share the Scare ‚Äì Nobody should be forced to go through hell alone! Fully playable in single player and local and online cooperative play, REANIMAL has a shared, directed camera, designed to maximize claustrophobia and tension.

What do you make of Reanimal from what you've seen so far? Are you keen to pick it up? Let us know.

[source store.steampowered.com]

Nintendo Life‚Äôs resident horror fanatic, when he‚Äôs not knee-deep in Resident Evil and Silent Hill lore, Ollie likes to dive into a good horror book while nursing a lovely cup of tea. He also enjoys long walks and listens to everything from TOOL to Chuck Berry.

  • Author Profile
  • Bluesky
  • Reply

item.title: Someone Might Have Just Bought The Last Brand-New Physical Copy Of 2008‚Äôs Spore
item.content:encoded:
Good morning! Welcome to the coolest show in town, Kotaku‚Äôs Morning Checkpoint. This is our daily roundup of video game news and other interesting stuff you might care about. Squeeze in, find a seat, and get ready to be blown away by this morning‚Äôs showcase, which includes bad news for fans of The Finals on PS4, more layoffs, Sakurai wanting to live a chill life, and more.

Some games that sold a single physical copy in October

According to data from Circana‚Äôs Matt Piscatella, some odd, old games sold exactly one new physical copy in the United States during October. If you were the person out there who bought a physical copy of Spore in October, email me a photo of the receipt. I want to talk to you about your life. I hope things turn around for you. And if you are the person who bought Incredibles 2: Rise of the Underminer on GBA last month, you are a wild individual, and I respect it. Here‚Äôs the full list:

  • 360- Burnout Paradise
  • 3DS- Carnival Games: Wild West 3D
  • GBA- Incredibles 2: Rise of the Underminer
  • NDS- Imagine Fashion Stylist
  • PC- Spore
  • PS2- Backyard Baseball
  • PS3- Hasbro Family Game Night 3
  • PS4- Cooking Mama Cookstar
  • XBX- Ultra Bust A Move

Avalanche Liverpool closes, 31 devs laid off

In September, Avalanche Liverpool, the studio behind the canceled Xbox game Contraband, announced it would be shutting down. And now that has happened. On November 19, the studio announced via its official website that it had completely closed its doors and 31 developers had been laid off as a result.

‚ÄúThe exceptional talent, passion, and commitment from everyone leaving have impacted every project. We are truly grateful for the dedication and invaluable contributions to Avalanche Studios Group. Our focus remains on supporting the Avalanchers through the transition and to carry on making great games for our player communities.‚Äù

Leave Smash Bros. creator Masahiro Sakurai alone

In a new interview with Game*Spark, Smash Bros. and Kirby creator Masahiro Sakurai talked about how he doesn‚Äôt consider his life all that interesting and wishes people would just focus on the games and not who made them. So he was surprised that people wanted to turn his story into a manga.

‚ÄúI think I‚Äôve always wanted to live an unassuming life,‚Äù Sakurai told the outlet, as translated by Gamesradar. ‚ÄúEven with [being contacted about creating the manga], I‚Äôm sure my response was something like ‚Äòreally?'‚Äù

‚ÄúI try my best to communicate my work to others, but I refrain from trying to promote myself. I think I‚Äôve always wanted to live an unassuming life. I think it‚Äôs best if people just play games, instead of looking at who made them.‚Äù

The Finals on PS4 will be shut down next year

Before Embark Studios released the massively popular Arc Raiders last month, the company published the destructive shooter The Finals across consoles and PC. It wasn‚Äôt as big of a hit, but it‚Äôs still kicking and getting updates. But not for much longer on PlayStation 4, as confirmed by the studio earlier this week.

‚ÄúWhen Season 10 begins (18th of March, 2026), we‚Äôll be retiring The Finals on PlayStation 4 and focusing our support on current generation hardware,‚Äù posted Embark Studios. ‚ÄúFrom that point on, you‚Äôll need to play there to keep enjoying the game. Your progress and purchases will be stored in your Embark ID and will transfer to anywhere you choose to play. We‚Äôre incredibly grateful to everyone who‚Äôs been part of the PS4 community.‚Äù

Huh, Panic Button handled some Switch 2 port upgrades for Nintendo

Remember how, when the Switch 2 launched, some popular OG Switch games published by Nintendo, like Super Mario Odyssey, got upgrades to look and play a bit better on the new machine? Well, turns out that Switch port experts Panic Button were contracted by Nintendo to handle those upgrades.

Panic Button was honored to be selected by Nintendo to help update marquee games from the Nintendo Switch‚Ñ¢ library. Nintendo asked us to help demonstrate new capabilities of the Nintendo Switch 2 system, while remaining faithful to the original games. pic.twitter.com/5P96V9DFUq

‚Äî Panic Button (Official) (@PanicButtonGame) November 19, 2025

I find this very interesting, as it seems like something Nintendo could have done internally. But instead, they trusted the folks at Panic to handle the upgrades. I bet Panic is feeling very good about that right now, and it will likely help the studio get even more work porting games to the new Switch 2.

ICYMI:

  • Deadpool VR is perfect‚Ä¶for fans of Deadpool
  • MrBeast‚Äôs new ‚Äútheme park‚Äù looks‚Ä¶uh‚Ä¶not great
  • Critics seem to mostly like Kirby Air Riders

Watch This:



https://kotaku.com/someone-might-have-just-bought-the-last-brand-new-physical-copy-of-2008s-spore-2000645800

item.title: Crucial P510 SSD With Heatsink Deal Makes Storage Cost Pennies, PC and PS5 Upgrades Feel Basically Free
item.content:encoded:
For PlayStation 5 owners who regularly find themselves bumping up against the console‚Äôs limited storage, keep reading. In the lead-up to Black Friday, Crucial has cut the price of one of its PS5-compatible SSDs, making it easier and more affordable to expand your game library. The 2TB Crucial P510 Gen5 NVMe SSD normally priced around $210 has been discounted by 29%, bringing the cost down to $150. That‚Äôs a meaningful $60 reduction on a high-performance SSD equipped with its own heatsink for seamless compatibility right out of the box.

See at Amazon

PS5 & PC Compatible

One of the most common frustrations among early PS5 adopters is the reality of the console‚Äôs internal storage limitations. Even though Sony technically lists the system as having an 825GB SSD, the usable space is significantly smaller. After accounting for system files and required software, players are left with roughly 667GB for game installs‚Äîa number that feels increasingly cramped as modern titles frequently climb past 100GB each. For anyone with a growing collection, or for those who enjoy bouncing between several big releases at once, that space disappears almost immediately. Installing Crucial‚Äôs 2TB expansion effectively triples the amount of room you have to work with, reducing the need to delete old favorites just to make space for new ones.

Beyond the raw storage boost, the drive is built to meet the PS5‚Äôs demanding performance standards. With read and write speeds up of to 11,000 MB/s, the Crucial P510 far exceeds what‚Äôs needed to keep pace with Sony‚Äôs ultra-fast architecture. The included heatsink, which is required for PS5 internal installation, helps maintain stable temperatures and prevent thermal throttling during extended gaming sessions.

If you‚Äôre planning to install the Crucial P510 SSD into a PC gaming desktop, you‚Äôll be able to make the most of its insanely fast read and write speeds. Just make sure your motherboard supports Gen5 NVMe SSDs. A Gen4 slot will still work with it, just won‚Äôt be able to reach the maximum speeds supported by the P510. With optimal conditions, you‚Äôll be able to experience lightning fast load times in your games as well as when working with high-intensive applications such as when video or photo editing. Plus with a full 2TB, you‚Äôll have plenty of room for not just your games, but any important pictures or vids you want to hang onto.

With its generous performance, significant storage increase, and a timely discount, Seagate‚Äôs 2TB Game Drive stands out as one of the most practical PS5 upgrades you can grab this season.

See at Amazon



https://kotaku.com/unlock-crazy-fast-load-times-on-your-gaming-pc-or-upgrade-your-ps5-storage-by-2tb-with-this-crucial-internal-ssd-for-60-off-2000645621

item.title: Kirby Air Riders Players Wasted No Time Creating Unhinged Vehicles
item.content:encoded:
Kirby Air Riders is out today, and it sounds like the chaotic kart racer is exactly what fans of the GameCube original wanted (and like it‚Äôs probably not for anyone else). One of the ways the Switch 2 game embraces disorder is in its vehicle customization, which lets you paint your hoverboard to look like pretty much whatever you want. Some players are using this feature to make cool karts to race around in, and others are seeing what monstrosities they can put on the market for other players to use.

Nintendo has held multiple feature-length Direct showcases for Air Riders, so we‚Äôve already known about its vehicle customization for a while. I wouldn‚Äôt be surprised if fans were planning some of their vehicular shitposts for some time and just needed the game in their Switch 2s to finally bring them to life. But the reason that people can make vehicles that look like Chef Kawasaki in a bikini from a banned fan game (thanks, GamesRadar+) is that the toolset is so good. So for every joke, you‚Äôll find a custom kart that actually looks pretty incredible. Y‚Äôall haven‚Äôt even had the game for a day, and you‚Äôre already killing it.

item.title: Hellraiser: Revival‚Äôs First Gameplay Trailer Is Hellish And Horrible
item.content:encoded:
The first gameplay trailer for Hellraiser: Revival has dropped, and it‚Äôs absolutely not for the faint of heart. If you thought the debut trailer was wince-worthy, this is just as nasty and as vile as you‚Äôd expect. It‚Äôs heaven, in hell.

A pleasant (also unpleasant) surprise dropped in July 2025 with a Hellraiser: Revival Trailer, revealed by Saber Interactive. It marks the first time the horror title has ever had its own standalone game, and the first gameplay trailer shows that you should expect every bit of the nastiness of the movies rolled into one.

Hellraiser: Revival Has Some Cenobite

Insider Gaming‚Äôs hands-on Gamescom preview tells you everything you need to know about Hellraiser: Revival.

An ‚Äúhour-long theater of violence and sadism‚Äù was one of many lines we used. Now, you can see the evidence for yourself through the first Hellraiser: Revival gameplay trailer. It has everything a Hellraiser fan is looking for: Nudity, graphic violence, and a sprinkling of Pinhead.

There‚Äôs also a lot of visceral combat, a look into the game‚Äôs brand-new story, and you also get a look at the game‚Äôs insistence on going the extra length with platforming and puzzling.

You can check out the footage for yourself, if you dare. All jokes aside, viewer discretion is advised.

Feel free to share your thoughts on the Hellraiser gameplay trailer. Is it as bad as you thought it was going to be? The Insider Gaming Discord Server is the perfect place to discuss the trailer and the Hellraiser franchise.

For more news, check out the report that Resident Evil Requiem ‚ÄòDefinitely‚Äô Has One DLC in the Works Right Now, and Reanimal Getting Its Release Date Confirmed. You can read all of this and more right here at Insider Gaming.

item.title: Resident Evil Requiem ‚ÄòDefinitely‚Äô Has One DLC in the Works Right Now, It‚Äôs Claimed
item.content:encoded:
An insider has stated that Resident Evil Requiem is definitely getting at least one DLC, which is currently in development.

Resident Evil Requiem doesn‚Äôt arrive until next year, and as we wait for the game‚Äôs launch, the only things getting us by are leaks. We recently saw the producer address rumours about the photo of Leon Kennedy with an eye patch that surfaced online. Now, an insider has revealed some details about the DLC.

Resident Evil Requiem DLC Might Star Alyssa

The details about the Resident Evil Requiem DLC come from Dusk Golem (Aesthetic Gamer), known for RE leaks. Their latest post on X (formerly Twitter) states, ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs definitely at least one DLC for Resident Evil Requiem in development right now. I‚Äôve heard about it a few times, believe it stars Alyssa.‚Äù The leaker had previously stated that Alyssa Ashcroft is also the giant monster following Grace in the trailer, and will be playable for a bit in the game.

Dusk Golem was also asked on the same day whether Leon Kennedy is being considered the main character or a side character in the upcoming title. Golem replied that they don‚Äôt have a blueprint for the game to give that answer, but they do know that Leon has ‚Äúsome very large levels, the biggest in the series to date‚Äù. Players should take both details with a grain of salt, as it does not come from an official source.

In other news, Capcom expects Resident Evil Requiem to sell better than Resident Evil Village. Additionally, the developers recently revealed why they ditched the multiplayer aspect of the title. What are your thoughts on the new claims about Resident Evil Requiem definitely having at least one DLC in development? Leave your thoughts down in the comments, and join the official Insider Gaming Discord server.

For more information from Insider Gaming, read about PlayStation Plus members getting free Winter Soldier skins in Marvel Rivals. Don‚Äôt forget to sign up for our weekly newsletter.

item.title: Hello Kitty Island Adventure sales top one million
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Switch 2

500,000 units sold since March.

Total sales for open-world adventure game Hello Kitty Island Adventure have surpassed one million units just 30 days after its January 30 release for Switch and PC via Steam, developer Sunblink announced.

Hello Kitty Island Adventure first launched for Apple Arcade on July 28, 2023, followed by Switch and PC via Steam on January 30, 2025, PlayStation 5 on August 5, 2025, and Switch 2 on November 13, 2025. A PlayStation 4 version was announced, but it is unclear whether it is still planned.

Sales for Hello Kitty Island Adventure were last reported in March to have surpassed 500,000 units, just one month after its Switch and PC release.

Here is a brief overview of the game, via Sunblink:

Hello Kitty Island Adventure has redefined the ‚Äúcozy adventure‚Äù genre, blending comforting activities like crafting and decorating with a vast, explorable world filled with quests, challenges and puzzle-solving. Widely celebrated by fans and critics alike, the game has been honored with Apple Arcade‚Äôs Game of the Year and a Webby People‚Äôs Voice Award, alongside major nominations including Best Mobile Game at The Game Awards 2023 and Mobile Game of the Year at the 27th Annual D.I.C.E. Awards.

In Hello Kitty Island Adventure, Hello Kitt¬Æ invites you to join her and her friends at Big Adventures Park, where My Melody‚Ñ¢ is opening a brand-new gift shop. Express yourself as an original, Sanrio-style avatar with a wide range of adorable customization options. Cook delicious food and decorate your space with hundreds of furniture items. Share gifts and complete quests to deepen your friendship with beloved characters. Invite other players to your island and complete multiplayer challenges or build beautiful vacation homes together.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/hello-kitty-island-adventure-sales-top-one-million

item.title: Death Howl launches December 9 for PC, in 2026 for PS5, Xbox Series, and Switch
item.content:encoded:
• PC
  • PS5
  • Switch
  • Xbox Series

Soulslike deckbuilder dated.

Soulslike deckbuilder Death Howl will launch for PC via Steam on December 9, followed by PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, and Switch in 2026, publisher 11 bit studios and developer The Outer Zone announced.

Here is an overview of the game, via 11 bit studios:

Blending beloved mechanics into something entirely its own, Death Howl is a genre-defying Soulslike deckbuilder that tells the story of Ro, a mother from a shamanic tribe, who refuses to accept the loss of her child. In a desperate act, she descends into the spirit world to fight for a second chance.

Minimalist in presentation but unafraid of raw, harrowing themes, Death Howl unfolds as a metaphorical journey through sorrow, survival and acceptance. It‚Äôs a hunt where every step forward carries a cost‚Äîand every enemy demands a study worthy of a huntress.

True to soulslike tropes, defeat is not the end, but part of the learning path. Resting revives fallen foes, and understanding enemy behavior is crucial to progress. Death Howl enhances this structure with tactical, grid-based combat, deck-building systems, and action-RPG exploration across eerie, hostile biomes.

Each region introduces not just new enemies and active and passive abilities, but also new cards that offer deck-tailoring possibilities, allowing players to shape their tactical approach as they progress. Every fallen spirit adds to Ro‚Äôs strength in this quiet war of grief and resolve.

Will Ro reclaim what was taken from her? Or will the spirit world take her too?

Watch a new trailer below.

Release Date Trailer



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/death-howl-launches-december-9-for-pc-in-2026-for-ps5-xbox-series-and-switch

item.title: All These Games Sold Exactly One Copy In The US In October
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Battlefield 6 sold many, many copies in the US in October, but which games sold precisely one copy? As it turns out, lots of games did that.

Circana's Mat Piscatella shared a list of games that sold one physical copy in the US in October, and they include Burnout Paradise for Xbox 360, The Incredibles 2: Rise of the Underminer for Game Boy Advance, and Backyard Baseball for the PlayStation 2.

You can see a longer list below, but note that it's not exhaustive. Some games only sold two copies in October, including Tom Clancy's End War for the PSP.

Something we do not know here is who is buying these games, where they're buying them, or why they're buying them. But Piscatella said it's not out of the ordinary. "Happens every month. There was a copy somewhere in the store for who knows how long," Piscatella said.

Games that sold one physical copy in the US in October:

  • Burnout Paradise (Xbox 360)
  • Carnival Games: Wild West 3D (3DS)
  • The Incredibles 2: Rise of the Underminer (Game Boy Advance)
  • Imagine Fashion Stylist (Nintendo DS)
  • Spore (PC)
  • Backyard Baseball (PS2)
  • Hasbro Family Game Night 3 (PS3)
  • Cooking Mama Cookstar (PS4)
  • Ultra Bust A Move (original Xbox)

As for Battlefield 6's chart-topping results, Circana doesn't share unit-sales data, but the game was No. 1 for October and quickly became the No. 1 best-selling game overall in the US for 2025 so far. Battlefield 6 even outpaced the first-month sales of Black Ops 6 and Modern Warfare 3.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/all-these-games-sold-exactly-one-copy-in-the-us-in-october/1100-6536387/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Pricey WoW Transmog Changes Have Players Angry And Confused
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

World of Warcraft's upcoming Midnight expansion is bringing sweeping changes to the MMORPG's transmog system, but they look to be far more expensive than players were led to believe.

Earlier this year when Midnight was fully revealed, developer Blizzard announced it would be overhauling the game's cosmetic outfit system in a way that would save players gold. Instead of having to pay gold to transmog individual gear pieces, players would instead transmog gear slots. That slot would then retain its appearance regardless of whatever item was equipped, useful as players level up and equip new gear over the course of an expansion or season.

Sounds good on paper. However, the system is now testable on the WoW: Midnight beta, and as broken down by Wowhead, players are discovering these supposedly cost-saving changes are actually extremely expensive.

At Midnight's level cap of 90, equipping a full transmog gear outfit costs around 5,700 gold, over four times more expensive than it is to equip that same set in the game right now. That means that unless a player changes their full set of gear five times, the current system is actually cheaper.

Transmog costs actually scale with level as well, so players will want to save their transmogs at lower levels to save on gold costs. It should be noted that players can save an appearance set for free just as they currently do, but actually equipping that set is where the gold costs comes in.

Outfit slots, a new feature in Midnight, also cost money. These are essentially saved transmog sets where players can go ahead and pay the transmog fee and then save that outfit for later use without having to pay the gold cost again. While players will be given two slots for free, additional slots (up to 20) cost increasingly more gold. The first few are hardly noticeable, with slot three costing 100 gold, slot four costing 500, and slot 5 costing 1,000. From there the gold costs begin to increase rapidly, with the last three slots costing 100,000 gold each.

Adding to the costs is the fact that outfits slots aren't account-wide and are instead on a per-character basis. For players who want multiple outfits on multiple characters, the gold costs begin to add up rather quickly, potentially costing millions of gold for those who want all 20 slots on multiple characters.

Outfit slots are mostly for players who want to be able to jump between transmog outfits frequently, and will work with the game's new "Situations" system. In this new system, players can change between their saved outfits automatically depending on the circumstances, and have a different appearance based on specific activities, like a cozy outfit when they are at their house or a different one when out in the open world or doing dungeons.

For those who change outfits often, the new system does technically save players gold. But for others who use transmog more casually, it could actually be more expensive. It's also a far more confusing system--one where players will now need to weigh the costs of buying new outfit slots and saving transmog sets versus overriding an existing set in an effort to save gold.

It's worth noting that all these prices are on the Midnight beta and will likely change before the expansion launches early next year, especially given the negative reception from players. But considering this feature was pitched as saving fashion-forward players money, as opposed to costing more, this feels like Blizzard took an easy win and instead turned it into a loss.

In other WoW news, early access to the game's housing system will arrive on December 2. Blizzard recently found itself in another controversy when it revealed a premium currency that will be used just for housing items on WoW's in-game shop, despite other items like mounts and transmog sets having always been sold for real currency.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com



https://www.gamespot.com/articles/pricey-wow-transmog-changes-have-players-angry-and-confused/1100-6536391/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

item.title: Canadian video game industry has doubled in size in the past decade
item.content:encoded:
Diego Arg√ºello, Contributing Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

November 20, 2025

3 Min Read

The characters of Goodbye Volcano High sit around a campfire in a scene from Canadian studio KO_OPImage via KO_OP

The Canadian video game industry has doubled in size from 2013 to 2022, jumping from 775 local firms to 1,628 in that time period.

According to a report from Statistics Canada published in September, the growth is attributed to Canadian-owed firms, companies primarily engaged in video game design rather an publishing, and small studios with fewer than five employees.

This, in turn, has had an effect in revenue, rising from $2 billion to $7 billion during that near-decade.

Just under 60,000 people were working in the Canadian industry in 2022, a 116.2 percent increase from the decade prior. In terms of specific cities and areas, Ontario had 638 game development firms, followed by British Columbia with 426 and Quebec with 338.

The majority of studios are small and Canadian owned

As the report notes, 97.4 percent of the video game businesses operating in the country in 2022 were Canadian owned. Moreover, 77.5 percent of the grand total were smaller studios with fewer than five employees.

It's worth noting that foreign-run companies, which the report says tend to be relatively larger businesses with 20 or more employees, generated more revenue than Canadian companies in 2022‚Äî$4 billion versus $3 billion.

Two other notable metrics include that one in four employees in the Canadian game industry are women. According to the report, the figure saw an increase of 17.8 percent in 2013 to 24.5 percent in 2021, while the shared paid to women increased from 14.4 percent to 20 percent.

Related:Avalanche finalizes Liverpool studio closure, lays off 31 workers

As noted by Statistics Canada, women's employment share is growing more rapidly than women's compensation share, likely the result of industry newcomers occupying entry-level positions with lower salaries.

Studio Closures slowed from 2014 to 2021

The second notable metric from the report involves entry and exit rates‚Äîmeaning, businesses opening and businesses closing shop. As per the report, entry rates for video game companies in Canada were higher from 2014 to 2018 but lower from 2019 to 2021, which is relative to all private employer firms. Then, from 2014 to 2021, exit rates for video game firms were much lower than those for all other private employer firms. 

The conclusion by Statistics Canada is that studio closures in the Canadian video games industry are "relatively rare."

Sadly, as we've seen in recent years, that metric appears to be changing. Sure, multiple companies have set up new studios in the region, including People Can Fly and Avalanche Studios, but despite the growth many workers have been caught in layoffs and studio closures.

Related:'Korea - they are the Joe Pesci of countries,' Unknown Worlds co-founder compiles plan to take on Krafton in newly-surfaced 'Litigation Help' document

In 2023, Ubisoft Montreal laid off staff amidst larger company reductions, affecting the Quebec branch as well. The following year, Sumo Group cut 15 percent of staff across Canada, Poland, and other regions. Then, after almost 20 years, Canadian studio Hothead Games shut down after filing for bankruptcy. Meanwhile, Sumo Group-owned outsourcing studio Atomhawk closed its Canadian branch two weeks ago, after eight years in operation.

But it's not all doom and gloom. In June, developer Ubisoft Halifax filed to unionize with media union CWA Canada. This followed the launch of an industry-wide union in March, called the United Videogame Workers-CWA, which was formed by workers across Canada and the United States, as well as efforts by Quebec game workers with Canadian trade union CSN in May of 2024, with the goal of helping workers establish unions at major studios in the region.

About the Author

Contributing Editor, News, GameDeveloper.com

Diego Nicol√°s Arg√ºello is a freelance journalist and critic from Argentina. Video games helped him to learn English, so now he covers them for places like The New York Times, NPR, Rolling Stone, and more. He also runs Into the Spine, a site dedicated to fostering and supporting new writers, and co-hosted Turnabout Breakdown, a podcast about the Ace Attorney series. He‚Äôs most likely playing a rhythm game as you read this.



https://www.gamedeveloper.com/business/canadian-video-game-industry-has-doubled-in-size-in-the-past-decade

item.title: Nintendo Download: 20th November (North America)
item.content:encoded:
The latest Nintendo Download update for North America has arrived, and it's bringing new games galore to the eShop in your region. As always, be sure to drop a vote in our poll and comment down below with your potential picks for the week. Enjoy!

Switch 2 eShop - Highlights

Hello Kitty Island Adventure Nintendo Switch 2 Edition (Sunblink, 13th Nov, $49.99) - Embark on a cozy adventure with Hello Kitty and Friends ‚Äì Hello Kitty Island Adventure Nintendo Switch 2 Edition is available now! The Nintendo Switch 2 Edition includes GameChat and mouse controls with higher framerates and smoother visuals. Explore and restore a mysterious island while befriending beloved Sanrio characters like Hello Kitty, Kuromi, My Melody and Cinnamoroll! (Note: If you own the Switch 1 version, you can buy the upgrade pack for $9.99)

Kirby Air Riders (Nintendo, 20th Nov, $69.99) - Pick your rider, pick your machine and mount up for competition! Take on your rivals in frantic arena battles or fast-paced races on the ground and in the air in the Kirby Air Riders game. Use the Boost Charge button to brake and control your turns as your machine automatically fights for top speed. Fill your Boost Charge Gauge as you drift around the bend and release it to trigger an explosive dash. Experience fast-paced vehicular action with Kirby Air Riders, available now on the Nintendo Switch 2 system. - Read our Kirby Air Riders review

SpongeBob SquarePants: Titans of the Tide (THQ Nordic, 18th Nov, $39.99) - Save Bikini Bottom in this brand-new ghostly adventure. A clash between the Flying Dutchman and King Neptune has unleashed ghostly mayhem all over Bikini Bottom. SpongeBob and Patrick will need all their skills, bravery and ‚Äì dare we say ‚Äì wit, to return life to what passes for normal. Join Bikini Bottom‚Äôs most notorious duo on their ghostliest adventure yet. SpongeBob SquarePants: Titans of the Tide is available now on Nintendo Switch 2.

Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition (Aspyr, 18th Nov, $19.99) - The Definitive Edition of the critically acclaimed action-adventure is here! Dive into the cinematic title that forced Lara Croft to grow from an inexperienced young woman into a hardened survivor. Re-built for next-gen consoles and featuring an obsessively detailed Lara and a stunningly lifelike world, Lara must endure high-octane combat, customize her weapons, and overcome grueling environments to uncover the island‚Äôs deadly secret.

Switch eShop - New Releases

As I Began to Dream (SOFT SOURCE, 20th Nov, $19.99) - After awakening to find herself trapped in a mysterious dream world, Lily is forced to face her past traumas and experiences. Harnessing a unique ability to swap, rotate, and move the environment around her, Lily progresses through the various worlds in a journey of navigating grief and finding herself.

BOSSGAME: The Final Boss Is My Heart (Dolores Ent., 21st Nov, $9.99) - Mammon City can be a rough place to live. Devils are everywhere, and the only decent job in town is hunting them down. Take charge of Sophie, sword priestess and generally anxious mess, and Anna, fire witch and localized disaster, as they fight, flirt, and try to pay the rent. Hunt horrifying devils, confront your corrupt employer, uncover the dark secrets behind Mammon City, and prove that evil doesn't stand a chance against the power of girlfriends.

Boxville Collection (Triomatica Games, 20th Nov, $16.99) - Step into the hand-drawn universe of Boxville ‚Äî a charming series of puzzle adventures about friendship, courage, and creativity. Explore beautifully animated cardboard cities, meet quirky can residents, and solve clever environmental puzzles to uncover the stories hidden inside every box.

Brotherhood (Valkyrie Initiative, 26th Nov, $9.99) - An ominous brotherhood of religious fanatics perform experiments on humans in their top-secret scientific complex. An ancient prison hidden deep in the Swiss mountains houses hundreds of test subjects whose bodies are mutilated in an effort to produce a new biological species of superhuman. You are one of them, but unlike other test subjects, your body is immune to mutagens. For you, it's not poison anymore, rather a source of power that makes your body nearly indestructible.

BUBBLE BOBBLE Sugar Dungeons (ARC SYSTEM WORKS, 26th Nov, $39.99) - Bub the bubble-blowing dragon goes on an adventure through sweet dungeons that change every time! Blow bubbles to catch bullies, use your horns and spikes to burst the bubbles and beat them! Bubbles can be carried by the wind, and you can get to high places by riding bubbles! Collect treasures in dungeons that change every time you step inside and conquer huge castles! Collecting treasure will strengthen Bub's abilities and skills. Get stronger along with Bub and explore the depths of treat-filled dungeons!

BUBBLE SYMPHONY (ARC SYSTEM WORKS, 26th Nov, TBA) - *This product is available for purchase as part of the bundle for ‚ÄúBUBBLE BOBBLE Sugar Dungeons‚Äù and ‚ÄúBUBBLE BOBBLE Sugar Dungeons Deluxe Edition‚Äù. A port of the 1997 home console version of the action game BUBBLE SYMPHONY, which originally appeared in arcades in 1994. Choose from four characters, each with different abilities, and play in two-player co-op mode! You can also enjoy a variety of worlds by choosing a course from the doors that appear after clearing each world.

Capybara Journey Go (globalgamestudio, 13th Nov, $2.99) - Capybara Journey GO is a colorful 2D adventure where you explore vibrant lands, search for hidden treasure, and build a team of courageous capybara heroes. Rush through more than one hundred fun and surprising levels, collect valuable items, and uncover secrets in new and unexplored worlds. Use a unique hook-based movement system to swing and launch yourself across the map at high speed. Jump, dash, and glide across islands while avoiding traps and dangerous creatures.

Croc‚Äôs Dynamite Blast (Sprakelsoft, 21st Nov, $6.99) - Choose between Croc, Baby Croc, Roodie or the clever Mole ‚Äì each with their own charm, all ready to blast their way to victory. Fans of the beloved Croc‚Äôs World series will recognize these characters, but this time they‚Äôre leaving platforming behind for high-energy battles packed with dynamite, chain reactions, and endless surprises.

Difficult Game About Letters (Abelix Games, 20th Nov, $4.99) - In A Difficult Game About Letters, you take control of a character who can transform into any letter of the alphabet. Each letter's shape provides unique abilities, which you‚Äôll need to solve puzzles, navigate obstacles, and complete challenging platforming levels.

Flag Trivia Quiz: Four Choices! (TT, 20th Nov, $8.99) - Flag Trivia Quiz ‚Äì Fun for both adults and kids! Brain-training with Flags √ó Knowledge"" is a ‚Äúlook and learn‚Äù four-choice quiz game themed around the flags of the world. Look at the flag and guess the correct country from four options! When you answer correctly, fun facts and trivia about that country appear, so you naturally learn about the world while playing.

Gensou -Yumegokochi- Illusion -Dreamlike- (Purmoe Design Lab, 22nd Nov, $14.99) - This game offers a completely new experience by blending nostalgic arcade territory control gameplay with modern Japanese art and new elements. In it, you must prevent the revival of the Supreme Leader and free the Y≈çkai that have been sealed away.

Glory Hunters (Ogre Pixel, 25th Nov, $9.99) - Glory Hunters is a retro action-adventure RPG where you progress by earning achievements. Complete over 600 deeds, help townsfolk, explore dungeons, and defeat bosses to earn Glory Points, the main currency that unlocks new paths, upgrades, and companions. Explore a vast world filled with secrets, mini-games, and quirky characters, and forge your own path through nonlinear gameplay and endless replay value.

Hypno Halo (Luna Wolf Studios, 25th Nov, $19.99) - There‚Äôs only one shape that‚Äôs perfect, eternal, and completely unbothered: the halo. FEATURES ‚Ä¢ Tackle 300+ handcrafted levels and 51 bonus challenges across 6 difficulties ‚Ä¢ Immerse yourself in 90+ minutes of electronic and techno music ‚Ä¢ Share controls with friends for co-op chaos ‚Ä¢ Discover secret endings and hidden surprises ‚Ä¢ Full touch screen support MUSIC BY ‚Ä¢ Damiano Baldoni ‚Ä¢ Rik4k ‚Ä¢ Zane Little

Love is all around 2 (NiuGamer, 13th Nov, $14.99) - Intiny proudly presents the official sequel to the Love is All Around series‚Äîmaking a spectacular return! This time, we invite you to step into the treacherous yet enchanting world of ancient martial arts and imperial courts, experiencing an unprecedented, immersive romantic adventure. Classic Cast, Delightful Reunions!

Magical Girls (AGE, 20th Nov, $5.00) - From magical girls to furry cat-eared girls, here come the cute girl characters! This is a unique block-busting game in which you destroy all the blocks placed on the stage to evolve the illustrations of cute girl characters.

MahjongPuzzle 8 (syn Sophia, 20th Nov, $1.99) - Mahjong Puzzle ‚ÄúEight‚Äù is a simple yet profound puzzle game that uses beautifully designed mahjong tiles. Conquer the various stages prepared in the ‚ÄúDragon Road‚Äù There are many elements to master, so aim for the ultimate score. Multiple mahjong tile skins are available, expanding the game‚Äôs world.

Michael‚Äôs Dream Adventure (HUNTERS, 19th Nov, $2.80) - Michael's Dream Adventure is a 2D platformer. Open doors and explore a variety of different worlds. Transform into various animals - including a cheetah, mole, elephant, cat, rabbit, and dog! Clear every stage to complete a grand picture!

Moonring DX (Fluttermind, 20th Nov, $15.00) - Five hundred years ago, the land of Caldera was plunged into endless darkness. Decades later, five moons rose in the sky, bringing light to the world and strange Gods with it. With them came the Dreams: calls to Devotion promising supernatural Gifts. Thus, the new Calderan civilisation was born; a world of Devotion and Dreamers, Gods and Gifts, with a Dreamless Archon acting as the Gods' mortal representative.

Mortal Trap Dungeon (Nerd Games, 22nd Nov, $5.99) - Explore Dungeons and overcome challenges in Mortal Trap Dungeon! Mortal Trap Dungeon is a precision platformer with exploration elements, with stages full of the most diverse enemies and traps! There are 16 phases with many challenges, be quick, act at the right time, run away from dozens of threats! Find the orb and be immortal! This is Mortal Trap Dungeon!

Neon Inferno (Retroware, 20th Nov, $19.99) - NEON INFERNO is a hybrid side-scroller and gallery-shooter where the action takes place in both the foreground and the background. As warring factions battle for control of a dystopian New York City, you enter the fray as an assassin for the Family ‚Äî a notorious crime syndicate determined to eliminate its rivals and dominate the metropolitan battlefield.

Ozymandias (Goblinz Studio, 20th Nov, $9.99) - At the dawn of history, Bronze Age kings built the first empires. Strategize their rise to power in a uniquely streamlined 4X. Expand your borders, build cities in tactical locations then raise armies to defend them. Each turn, you receive opportunities but must choose only one, complete the objective to earn the reward. Random victory conditions make every game different; custom victory conditions support different styles of play.

Picnic Girls (AGE, 13th Nov, $3.49) - A puzzle game featuring tons of cute Picnic Girls enjoying the autumn season is here! Collect pieces of adorable Picnic Girls enjoying the fall and complete the puzzle! There are 15 stages in total. As you clear each stage, the difficulty increases!

Revival: Recolonization (HeroCraft, 20th Nov, $29.99) - Set in a post-apoc version of Earth, Revival is a 4x strategy game where the world and its rules can change at key moments, creating a deep and highly replayable experience. Revival generates a vast possibility space for you to play around with. From sudden weather changes to zombie infestations and bans on certain weapon types ‚Äì boy, you are in for a surprise.

R-Type Delta: HD Boosted (Clear River Games, 20th Nov, $22.49) - R-Type Delta is one of the finest shoot ‚Äòem ups ever and took the gaming world by storm upon its release in 1998. Now, 27 years later, history repeats itself with R-Type Delta: HD Boosted. With its tight level design, three selectable ships, powerful Delta Weapons, and the brilliant Force mechanic, this new edition proves that gaming classics of this caliber are truly timeless. - Read our R-Type Delta: HD Boosted review

Samurai Academy: Paws of Fury (MAXIMUM ENT FRANCE, 20th Nov, $24.99) - The village of Kakamucho is under attack by the Shogun‚Äôs cat armies! Join Hank, a dog samurai in a world of cats, and his friends as they reveal a sinister plot and save the day, samurai-style. Slash, dash, and laugh through this wacky third-person action adventure.

Schildmaid MX (eastasiasoft, 26th Nov, $19.99) - Outnumbered and outgunned in deep space? No problem! Turn your enemies' attacks into pure bullet heaven with your advanced Schildmaid technology and start collecting dangerous projectiles to power up your ship and score big! But when your shield runs out and danger time kicks in, you‚Äôd better switch up your strategy fast.

Shadow Rift: Feral Strike (TROOOZE, 13th Nov, $14.99) - A first-person shooter where you fight against the threat of coordinated global terrorism as a member of Operation Shadow Lift, a multinational counterterrorism special forces unit. Track operatives hiding in blue container trucks at a quiet port facility at dawn, intercept mobile rockets launched from secret desert bases, and engage in urban warfare alongside heavy armored tanks in cities under states of emergency.

Solid Void Art Nonograms (Infinite Zone, 20th Nov, $7.99) - Solid Void combines classic nonogram puzzles with pentomino-like jigsaws. Uncover the art bits hidden in nonograms and finish them in the other puzzle style to see beautiful artwork! Solid Void delivers hours of relaxing but also challenging gameplay. Whether you're a nonogram veteran or a newbie, the game is well-balanced and you'll surely enjoy your time spent on solving the puzzles. Bring beautiful art to life and master Solid Void!

Sumikkogurashi Create a Wonderful Sumikko Island! (NIPPON COLUMBIA, 19th Nov, $49.99) - In this game, you'll build a cozy island together with Sumikko. Collect materials, fulfill Sumikko's requests, create various items, and decorate the island to make it popular! The more the island becomes popular and developed, the more features are unlocked, like expanding areas and attracting other Sumikko to the island, so let's work together with Sumikko and create a wonderful island!

Terrifier: The ARTcade game (Selecta Play, 21st Nov, $19.99) - Step into the oversized, blood-splattered shoes of Art the Clown in this old-school, arcade-style beat ‚Äòem up inspired by the most brutal horror games of the ‚Äò80s and ‚Äò90s. But don‚Äôt expect a scripted scream-fest as Art carves his own path of chaos, gutting cops, mangling stunt performers, and terrorizing film sets with his signature blend of sadistic humour and nightmarish brutality.

Tomb Raider: Definitive Edition (Aspyr, 18th Nov, $19.99) - The cinematic action-adventure that forced Lara Croft to grow from an inexperienced young woman into a hardened survivor has been re-built for next-gen consoles, featuring an obsessively detailed Lara and a stunningly lifelike world. Lara must endure high-octane combat, customize her weapons and gear, and overcome grueling environments to survive her first adventure and uncover the island‚Äôs deadly secret.

Truck Simulator 2025: City Work Delivery (Play, 18th Nov, $7.99) - Welcome to the ultimate truck driving experience! Truck Simulator 2025: City Work Delivery brings you the thrill of driving powerful cargo trucks through bustling city streets and challenging offroad terrains. Fasten your seatbelt and take on the role of a professional truck driver.

Village Climb Obby (Downmeadowstreet, 21st Nov, $2.99) -Get ready for a thrilling parkour adventure! In Village Climb Obby, the once-peaceful village is now completely flooded ‚Äî and it‚Äôs up to you to climb, jump, and race your way through tricky obstacles to escape!

Zombie Disaster Drill (MAGES., 20th Nov, $6.59) - Welcome to the Disaster Prevention Center! Thank you very much for visiting us today. Today, you will participate in a disaster drill simulating a ‚Äòzombie disaster‚Äô and learn how to handle a typical zombie disaster. Follow my guidance and let's aim to become zombie disaster prevention experts!

Zombie Royale io (DubassGames, 20th Nov, $4.99) - Zombie Royale. io throws you headfirst into a chaotic undead uprising where survival depends on sharp reflexes, quick upgrades, and relentless firepower. Start as a lone survivor with nothing but a pistol and big zombie problems. Blast your way through endless waves of the undead, collect cash, and use it to unlock better weapons, faster fire rates, and beefier allies.

So that's your lot for this week's North American Nintendo Download. Go on, be a sport and drop a vote in the poll above, and comment below with your hot picks!



https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/11/nintendo-download-20th-november-north-america

item.title: Pok√©Park Kanto Includes A Major Area Those With Limited Mobility Can't Access
item.content:encoded:
As you may already be aware, Pok√©Park Kanto is officially opening to the public on 5th February 2026. The Pok√©mon-branded theme park will be a permanent fixture in Yomiuriland in Tokyo's Tama Hills, and will be divided into two core areas: Pok√©mon Forest and Sedge Town.

The thing is, if you have limited mobility, then you might not be allowed into the Pok√©mon Forest area at all. Yes, as covered by IGN, the official Pok√©Park website states that those "unable to climb 110 steps without assistance" will not be allowed to enter. In addition, the Japanese site states that those who require the use of a wheelchair will also be restricted. Understandably, the site clarifies that this is "to ensure visitor safety".

Of course, it's not entirely surprising given the nature of the attraction. The Pok√©mon Forest is described as a 500m long nature trail featuring steep hills, tunnels, and stairs, and the site even says that visitors should expect "grassy areas and uneven paths". Children under 5 will also not be allowed to take part, even if accompanied by an older guest. Inclement weather may also lead to the suspension of the attraction altogether.

Individuals for which any of the following applies cannot enter:

Those under the influence of alcohol, with heart conditions, who are pregnant, with high or low blood pressure, who are feeling unwell, who are unable to climb 110 steps without assistance, and those with conditions or symptoms that may worsen by using the park.

Sedge Town, meanwhile, will offer up a whole bunch of additional attractions, including rides, stores, and Sedge Gym, where attendees can watch Pok√©mon stage shows. You'll also have a chance to connect with other 'Pok√©mon Trainers' at the Primarina Fountain.

So it sounds like there's at something for everyone at Pok√©Park Kanto, even if you won't be able to access the Pok√©mon Forest. Tickets will be available for Japanese residents from 21st November and issued via a lottery system.

What do you make of Pok√©Park Kanto so far? Do these restrictions affect you in any way? Let us know with a comment.



https://www.nintendolife.com/news/2025/11/pokepark-kanto-includes-a-major-area-those-with-limited-mobility-cant-access

item.title: Dragon Quest VII Reimagined Preview - Return to Eden
item.content:encoded:
Dragon Quest has been having a renaissance with the recent releases of Dragon Quest I & II HD-2D Remake and Dragon Quest III HD-2D Remake. These remakes garnered high praise among the masses for revitalizing three iconic classics for the modern era, and make no mistake‚ÄîSquare Enix has every intention of continuing to deliver amazing, creative remakes of timeless classics with the upcoming release of Dragon Quest VII Reimagined. This game is sure to stun audiences with its beautiful hand-crafted 3D art style, modern gameplay features, and heartwarming story.

Dragon Quest VII Reimagined is based on the original PlayStation title released in 2000 in Japan, then remade for the Nintendo 3DS in 2013, and focuses on the adventures of a group of childhood friends who leave their home of Estard Island to embark on a high-stakes adventure across the seas and through time itself to battle against unknown, evil forces and discover the mysteries of their world.

My one-hour hands-on experience with Dragon Quest VII Reimagined showed off a delightful game full of charm and mystique while also embodying the same fun, lighthearted spirit that made the original Dragon Quest VII such a well-revered title among fans of the franchise. 

I started my time in the demo in Wetlock, a small town playing host to a traveling musician named Old Man Riffer. When I entered the village, Old Man Riffer was entertaining the villagers with his torban before quickly trying to leave despite the villagers' protests. At night, while staying in the inn, a haunting melody began to play, opening portals that spirit away the villagers into the unknown, prompting the party to investigate the strange disappearances. 

When traversing the continent in search of answers, I found myself stumbling across Spliton-on-Sea, an abandoned fishing village that exhibited signs of being plagued by the same mystery as Wetlock. While exploring the map and interacting with important locations, the playable characters would trigger opportunities to talk to certain characters to get their thoughts on current events and helpful hints on where to go next.

Eventually, I found my way to Highendreigh Tower and began uncovering the truth behind the disappearances in Wetlock and Spliton-on-Sea, which led to the sudden appearance of Gracos the Demon King, who submerged the entire small island continent in water. 

If you‚Äôve ever played a Dragon Quest game before or if you‚Äôre new to the franchise, the mechanics are easy to catch on to. Players get four basic commands: Attack, which launches a basic attack with your equipped weapon; Skills, which allows players to chose from a variety of abilities and spells that can be used by each character based on their growth and class; Items that can be used to to heal and buff players or attack and debuff enemies; and Defend to reduce damage from incoming enemy attacks.

The Let Loose ability has also been added to Dragon Quest VII Reimagined, which activates after a character has been worked up during combat to allow them to unleash a powerful attack or skill. 

Dragon Quest VII Reimagined also introduces the brand-new feature called Moonlighting, where the player can assign an additional class to each playable character to gain special abilities and skills to the playable characters. These additional classes can be changed at-will while playing without having to go anywhere special, like a church, inn, or checkpoint to change that additional vocation, and I found it really fun to be able to switch them whenever to create different strategic combinations before heading into battle.

One of my favorite characters to utilize was Aishe, who had Destiny‚Äôs Dancer as one of her vocations, giving her access to M-Pathy, a powerful healing spell.

I also had her as a Troubadour, which allowed her to cast Divine Intervention to prevent the party from experiencing instant death from an attack. This combination made her a powerhouse healer while still being effective at offensive attacks with her sword. Ruff, Maribel, and the protagonist also had their own combination of unique spells and abilities in the demo, and being able to mix and match to address any combat situation helped to keep the game refreshing and engaging.

The second location available in the demo was Emberdale at an earlier part of the game, which allowed me the chance to play as Kiefer, the Prince of Estard, alongside Maribel and the protagonist. When the party arrived in Emberdale, the town had been experiencing strange tremors from the volcano near their town, so they started preparations for the Flaming Festival to give fire back to the volcano as a tribute in hopes of stopping it from erupting.

Meanwhile, Palmela, the town clairvoyant, had been trying to prevent the townspeople from doing that because she was certain the volcano would erupt because of it. At night, the townsfolk go to the volcano and begin feeding it their flames, but it slowly awakens the Glowering Inferno, a fire-based monster that had been living inside the volcano with plans to destroy the continent Emberdale sits on. 

The battle against the Glowering Inferno felt tense due to the limited abilities the party had access to in this demo, but it may also have to do with the fact that I sped down to the bottom of the volcano without fighting many enemies along the way. 

Despite the difficulties of the battle, various vocational abilities aided in making the battle easier to progress through. The protagonist had the Fledgling Fisherman vocation, which allowed him to use Ocean‚Äôs Devotion, an ability that made it so each ally would neutralize the next attack that targeted them.

Maribel, as a Mini Mayoress, could use Shewrd Operator, which allowed her to see through enemy resistances to make elemental attacks more effective. Keifer with the Heir Apparent vocation would cast Royal Flush, which reduced his defense stats while significantly increasing his attack power and critical hit chances. 

As I played through both demos, I couldn‚Äôt help but focus on the standout aspect of Dragon Quest VII Reimagined: the graphics. The beautiful diorama-esque style makes it feel like the player is looking down on a miniature world while moving around living-breathing maquettes rather than just simple 3D models.

It makes sense given Square Enix scanned in hand-crafted, super-detailed dolls of all of the main playable characters to give the game its unique, distinct art style, differentiating it from other Dragon Quest games while still embodying the charm of the character designs illustrated by the late Akira Toriyama.

As I finished my time with Dragon Quest VII Reimagined, I couldn‚Äôt help but wish I could have played even more because of how much fun I was having. There were also plenty of hidden mysteries within the demo that I wished I had the chance to find and experience, but that just means I have plenty to look forward to when the game comes out next year, and fans of the franchise or newcomers looking for a new turn-based RPG will also have plenty to enjoy and explore, too.

TechRaptor was invited to preview Dragon Quest VII Reimagined by the publisher. All screenshots were provided by the publisher.

Erren is a staff writer for TechRaptor whose writing experience stems from years of helming Nova Crystallis ‚Äì a website dedicated to everything Square Enix‚Ä¶ More about Erren



https://techraptor.net/gaming/previews/dragon-quest-vii-reimagined-preview-return-to-eden

item.title: Golden Joystick Awards 2025 ‚Äì All Award Winners
item.content:encoded:
On November 20, the Golden Joystick Awards 2025 took place in London, and there was no shortage of awards to be given out to the various winners this year.

It‚Äôs the 43nd-Annual edition of the Golden Joystick Awards, and it featured 24 awards and dozens of games both large and small sharing the stage for the show. Nearly all of the awards are voted on by the fans with just four being decided by a panel of critics and creators. Those four awards are: Streamers‚Äô Choice, Breakthrough, Critics‚Äô Choice, and Lifetime Achievement.

Check out the full list of award nominees and winners below and let us know what your thought of the fan‚Äôs choices in the comments or official Insider Gaming Discord server. The winners of each award appear and are bolded as they are announced.

item.title: Co-op open-world survival roguelite game Brightfall announced for PC
item.content:encoded:
About

Make it through the darkness‚Äîor become a part of it.

Brightfall is a cooperative open-world survival roguelite for up to four players, set on a cursed 17th-century island erased from English maps. Build, craft, and push back the living darkness before it swallows the world.

Welcome to the Isle the Crown Pretends Doesn‚Äôt Exist

The year is 1666. The Great Plague of London has just ended‚Ä¶ But it seems your troubles are only just beginning. You awaken shipwrecked on Brightfall Island, a place so cursed that even the Royal Navy has orders to pretend it doesn‚Äôt exist.

They say every plague in history began here‚Äîthe Black Death, the Justinian blight, and now, the darkness reborn.
Fog hides it from the world, storms guard its shores‚Ä¶ and yet the Crown thinks it‚Äôs a perfect place to put its prisoners.

One of them was you.

Now you‚Äôll have to scavenge, build, and fight to keep your light burning a little longer‚Äîbecause when it dies, your sanity follows. Explore abandoned Celtic ruins, upgrade your character, and craft stronger light sources to push deeper into the evershifting gloom.

But beware‚Äîlight fades, monsters grow stronger, and even your friends can fall to the madness.

Beware the Living Darkness

Branches twist. Birdsong fades. Trees grow wild and unfamiliar. You have stepped into the darkness‚Äîand it is watching you.

On Brightfall, darkness is not just the absence of light. It bends trees, warps stone, and unravels the world until nothing human remains.

But you are not powerless.

Every torch buys you a minute of sanity.

Use it wisely to carve a circle of sanity in the gloom, pushing corruption back one trembling step at a time. The deeper you dare to go, the stronger that light must become.

Let it fade, and the island will take you back.

Hold the Light‚ÄîAlone or Together

Survival in Brightfall is a shared struggle against time, dwindling supplies, and the creeping dark. One up to four survivors can brave the island together. Scavenge, craft, and defend the light while your friends argue about who forgot the tinder again.

Prefer to walk the path alone? The island won‚Äôt let you face it completely unaided. A flicker of ancient will‚Äîa Celtic spirit bound to the light‚Äîcan guide your steps, mend your wounds, and whisper warnings when the dark closes in.

Be kind to your companions‚Äîliving or spectral. You might need them to drag you out of the grave within the next hour. When one of you falls, the others can bring them back by burning a Resurrection Token‚Äîa spark of the same light that keeps the darkness at bay.

Lose them all, and the expedition ends. The map collapses, the cycle resets, and the island changes its shape once more.

Venture into the Unknown

Beyond the fragile glow of your base lies an island that refuses to stay still. Each failure reshapes its coasts and ruins‚Äîtwisting paths, swallowing landmarks, and spitting them out somewhere new.

But not all is lost. Every corrupted biome you cleanse and every ancient beast you fell leaves behind a sanctuary, a small fortress of light that endures through the resets. These sanctuaries let you push deeper‚Äîinto deserts scorched by false suns, frozen cliffs where even shadows freeze, and finally, the Heart of Darkness itself.

The more you reclaim, the harder the island fights back.

Turn Fire and Iron Into Salvation

You start with nothing but your bare hands and a flickering torch. Hunt for scraps, stitch together rags, and raise a shack against the storm. Then come iron tools. Then musket fire. Then sanctuaries so bright the darkness itself shrinks away.

Each expedition expands your reach: sawmills, quarries, mines, even automatons that harvest while you explore. As you gather resources and unlock blueprints, your base grows from a flickering campfire into a safe haven.

Not all heroes wield swords. Some build the light that lets the rest survive.

Die. Learn. Repeat.

Every expedition is only the beginning. Brightfall remembers what you‚Äôve earned, but never lets you rest easy.

Knowledge wrested from the dark becomes new skills, unique blueprints, and insights. With each run, you forge stronger tools, unlock fresh abilities, and carve your own path through the gloom. You can choose from distinct roles and looks, customize your path and skills, then update them independently from the World‚Äô state.

The world reshapes after every fall‚Äîbut wisdom endures. And in Brightfall, wisdom burns brighter than fire.

Survive the Dark, or Become Part of It

Your sanity fades with the light.

Stray too far into the dark, and it will begin to whisper. At first, it‚Äôs just the wind. Then footsteps. Then your own voice, asking you to stay.

The longer you linger, the more it takes‚Äîyour sight, your thoughts, your name. Until nothing human remains.

Those who stray too far become Shadows, mindless hunters drawn to the warmth of their former allies.

Only your team can bring you back‚Äîif they‚Äôre fast enough. Drag your friend toward the firelight‚Ä¶ or run before the darkness wears their face.

One way or another, everyone answers the dark eventually.

Key Features

  • Beware the Living Darkness ‚Äì Light is your only weapon. Ignite lanterns, push back corruption, and carve circles of sanity in a world that twists with every flicker.
  • Survive Together or Perish Alone ‚Äì Brave the cursed island with 1-4 players. Scavenge, craft, and defend your shared flame while arguing over who forgot the tinder again.
  • Venture into the Unknown ‚Äì Each fall reshapes the island. Cleanse corrupted biomes, conquer ancient bosses, and anchor new sanctuaries that endure between runs.
  • Turn Fire and Iron Into Salvation ‚Äì Your torchlight may fade, but your creations burn brighter with every expedition.
  • Die, Learn, and Rise Again ‚Äì Every failure feeds your knowledge. Unlock new blueprints, roles, and skills that persist across resets, growing stronger as the island grows crueler.
  • Resist or Embrace the Madness ‚Äì The longer you linger in the dark, the more it calls your name. Save your friends from the abyss, or join it and hunt them instead.

Everything Clear?

Jolly good‚Äînow try not to die, lad.

Or better yet: join our Discord or the Steam discussions and tell us what you‚Äôd like to see on the island.

Brightfall is a story we want to write with you‚Äîone mad idea at a time.

Watch the announcement trailer below.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/co-op-open-world-survival-roguelite-game-brightfall-announced-for-pc

item.title: Mobile Suit Gundam: Silver Phantom coming to PS VR2 on November 21
item.content:encoded:
• PS VR2

An interactive and cinematic anime.

Publisher Astrea and developers Bandai Namco Filmworks, Atlas V, and Albyon will release ‚Äúinteractive and cinematic anime‚Äù Mobile Suit Gundam: Silver Phantom for PlayStation VR2 on November 21, the companies announced.

Mobile Suit Gundam: Silver Phantom first launched for Quest on October 3, 2024.

Here is an overview of the game, via Astrea:

About

Embark on an epic adventure with Mobile Suit Gundam: Silver Phantom, a groundbreaking virtual reality experience.

The First-Ever Interactive and Cinematic Anime

This feature-length interactive cinematic story tailored for Gundam enthusiasts, anime fans, and virtual reality lovers alike, will offer a unique opportunity to dive deep into the heart of one of Japan‚Äôs most iconic anime universes.

Set in the Universal Century, this immersive journey places you at the center of an interactive cinematic experience like no other. As the main character of your own story, you‚Äôll be able to explore the universe of Mobile Suit Gundam like never before.

Get it today and prepare to discover what it truly means to be a hero in the Universal Century. Your Gundam awaits!

item.title: MARVEL Cosmic Invasion physical editions announced
item.content:encoded:
Publisher Dotemu and developer Tribute Games will release physical standard and ‚ÄúDeluxe‚Äù editions of MARVEL Cosmic Invasion for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, and Switch on March 13, 2026, the companies announced. The Switch 2 version will ship with the full game on the card.

The ‚ÄúDeluxe‚Äù edition will include a copy of the game, a SteelBook, a set of 15 5.32 x 6.69‚Ä≥ premium character art cards, a set of sticker sheets, a 21.38 x 13.31‚Ä≥ poster, and a collectible art box. Pre-orders are available now at participating retailers.

Pricing for the physical editions is as follows:

  • Standard Edition
    • PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch ‚Äì $39.99
    • Switch 2 ‚Äì $49.99 (full game on card)
  • Deluxe Edition
    • PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch ‚Äì $59.99
    • Switch 2 ‚Äì $69.99 (full game on card)

MARVEL Cosmic Invasion is due out digitally for PlayStation 5, Xbox Series, Switch 2, PlayStation 4, Xbox One, Switch, and PC via Steam on December 1, 2025.

Here is an overview of the game, via Dotemu:

In MARVEL Cosmic Invasion, the immortal Super Villain Annihilus has launched an unprecedented attack across the galaxy, threatening all life as we know it. Fighters, both Earth-born and cosmic, must now join forces in a star-spanning adventure against the deadly Annihilation Wave. Choosing from a unique roster of characters, brawl through the streets of New York City all the way to the depths of the Negative Zone to foil Annihilus‚Äô vow to spread death across the cosmos with the help of Thanos, M.O.D.O.K, Taskmaster and more devious allies.

Defend the cosmos with a 15-hero playable roster, fighting as Captain America, She-Hulk, Rocket Racoon, Wolverine, Spider-Man, Storm, Phyla-Vell, Venom, Nova, Black Panther, Beta Ray Bill, Cosmic Ghost Rider, Silver Surfer, Phoenix or Invincible Iron Man. MARVEL Cosmic Invasion gives players an incredible variety of skills and styles to mix and match as they traverse across the cosmos in a star-spanning adventure.

Choose and control your own team of two characters while tagging between them mid-fight with the innovative Cosmic Swap system, capitalizing on distinct superpowers and special attacks to create unique team-ups and dish out devastating damage.

Unlock stellar powerups and rewards while experimenting with different duos and bash through a fantastic collection of locales and nemeses from the MARVEL universe. MARVEL Cosmic Invasion‚Äòs action includes a range of accessibility features, empowering the whole family to be Super Heroes (or Villains) and supports four player drop-in/drop-out local and online co-op with crossplay.

After setting the bar for arcade-inspired beat ‚Äôem ups with the acclaimed, multimillion-selling smash hit Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Shredder‚Äôs Revenge, Dotemu and Tribute Games modernize the timeless fun of brawlers with exciting tag-team fighting and a multi-era celebration of the most iconic comic book universe. MARVEL Cosmic Invasion embodies the spirit of classic MARVEL character designs and delivers thrilling action that‚Äôd look right at home in an arcade cabinet.



https://www.gematsu.com/2025/11/marvel-cosmic-invasion-physical-editions-announced

item.title: Back to the Future's Marty McFly And The DeLorean Are Seemingly Coming To Fortnite
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

It's looking more and more like characters from multiple movies will be featured in Fortnite Chapter Seven near the end of this month. Kill Bill's The Bride has already been confirmed, and now it looks like Marty McFly from Back to the Future will arrive shortly thereafter. And it seems likely that Marty will be bringing Doc Brown's time-traveling DeLorean with him.

Leaks from a Fortnite Chapter Seven event appears to indicate that Marty will be a part of the Battle Pass with the Bride. The leak from Shiina doesn't specify if or how the DeLorean will be utilized, but Epic Games is already using the car in Rocket League.

LEAKED CHAPTER 7 INFO FROM CREATOR EVENT üíÄ
- Hot air balloons
- Driveable Reboot Vans
- Solo VS Bots mode
- Rift A Palooza events that spawn rifts
- Gameplay UI update
- Battle Pass has Marty McFly and The Bride pic.twitter.com/l9lBrLZMIz

‚Äî Shiina (@ShiinaBR) November 20, 2025

Some of the other rumored characters said to be heading to Chapter Seven include Harry Potter and James Bond. Other reports suggest that the next Fortnite map "will begin with a distinctive Los Angeles flavor and will have a desert biome." Since Epic is spelling out the word "seven" for this chapter, it's led to speculation that The Seven--a team of heroes who used to appear in Fortnite--may finally get their comeback.

The current Simpsons-themed mini-season is set to conclude on November 29. In the meantime, a giant--and shirtless-Homer Simpson is bringing his nipples to the game. In the eight years since Fortnite was launched, no character has ever been shown with nipples until now.

Earlier this week, Epic CEO Tim Sweeney announced a collaboration with Unity, which will eventually bring Unity games into Fortnite. Next year, Fortnite will also be able to host standalone games.

Fortnite was also recently added to the Xbox PC Store, but the launch didn't go very well at all.

item.title: PokePark Kanto's Big Adventure Comes With Big Restrictions
item.content:encoded:
GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

PokePark Kanto is a new, permanent Pokemon theme park opening in Japan next February. It is designed to make visitors feel like real Pokemon trainers as they explore a lively town area and a large forest inspired by the anime and video games. While many fans may be excited to catch 'em all, they may be surprised to learn that a major part of the park comes with strict entry rules.

The Pokemon Forest has many safety restrictions that limit who can enter. According to the park's English-language site, visitors must be able to walk up 110 steps without help, as well as wheelchair users and children under five are not allowed in the Forest. People who are pregnant, have heart or blood pressure issues, have been drinking alcohol, or feel unwell on the day of their visit are also restricted from entering.

The park will be situated within Yomiuriland, Tokyo's largest theme park. PokePark Kanto is split into two main areas: the Pokemon Forest and Sedge Town. The Forest is a 500-meter nature trail filled with hills, tunnels, and stairs, where visitors can find statues of Pokemon in their natural habitats. Sedge Town offers shops, rides, and a gym where guests can watch special Pokemon stage shows.

These rules may limit the enjoyment of certain areas of the park for some guests, especially since both ticket types include access to the Forest. The Ace Trainer's Pass (14,000 yen) allows free entry to both areas and offers extra perks like priority lines, reserved show seats, meet-and-greets, and special merchandise. The lower-priced Trainer's Pass (7,900 yen) includes unlimited entry to Sedge Town and a timed slot for the Forest. The park also forbids certain items, including drones, suitcases, and selfie sticks. Like most theme parks, it also bans most outside food and drink, with exceptions for infants and those with dietary restrictions.

The Sedge Town area will become more accessible as the park plans to introduce a Town-only pass by Summer 2026 to "ensure everyone can safely and comfortably enjoy the park." This new option will be the park's cheapest ticket, priced at 4,700 yen for adults, 4,200 yen for seniors, and 2,800 yen for children and guests with disabilities.

Residents of Japan can enter a ticket lottery by registering on the official PokePark KANTO website starting at 6 PM (JST) on November 21, 2025, which requires site membership and SMS verification using a Japan-capable mobile phone. The lottery covers tickets for the period of February 5 to March 31, 2026, with registration open from November 21 to December 8. Winners will be notified in the latter third of each month, and payments must be completed between December 21 and December 31. No information is yet available for fans outside of Japan about being able to come to the park.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
